org.jgrapes.core

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapes.core.internal.EventBase
      • org.jgrapes.core.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Matchable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCompletedEvent, Attached, Detached, Handler.NO_EVENT, HandlingError, NamedEvent, Start

    public class Event
extends EventBase
    The base class for all events. Event classes form a hierarchy. By default (i.e. as implemented by this class), the event's class (type) is used for matching. A handler is invoked if its event class is equal to or a base class of the class of the event to be handled.

    This default behavior can be changed by overriding the methods from Matchable. See NamedEvent as an example.

    Author:
    mnl

    • Method Detail

      • getChannels

        public Channel[] getChannels()
        Returns the channels associated with the event. Before an event has been fired, this returns the channels set with setChannels(Channel[]). After an event has been fired, this returns the channels that the event has effectively been fired on (see Manager.fire(Event, Channel...)).
        Returns:
        the channels

      • setChannels

        public void setChannels(Channel[] channels)
        Sets the channels that the event is fired on if no channels are specified explicitly when firing the event (see Manager.fire(Event, Channel...)).
        Parameters:
        channels - the channels to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the method is called after this event has been fired

      • getMatchKey

        public java.lang.Object getMatchKey()
        Description copied from interface: Matchable
        Returns the key used for matching.
        Returns:
        the key which usually is a String, a Class or an instance of Component (for channels only)

      • matches

        public boolean matches(java.lang.Object handlerKey)
        Description copied from interface: Matchable
        Returns true if this Matchable matches the key used as filter by a handler.
        Parameters:
        handlerKey - the key used by the handler

      • handlingError

        protected void handlingError(EventManager mgr,
                             java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Implements the default behavior for handling events thrown by handler. Fires a handling error event for this event and the given throwable.
        Specified by:
        handlingError in class EventBase
        Parameters:
        mgr - the manager that has invoked the handler
        throwable - the exception that has been thrown by the handler
        See Also:
        HandlingError
